title: British Indian War Department Pamphlet MCQ 1

content.prompt: Which of the following best explains why the British government felt the need to distribute the pamphlet?

choices.label: British authorities were concerned that going to war against a Muslim country could fuel anti-imperialist protests among India’s large Muslim population.
Many people in Britain regarded the First World War as a religious conflict between Christian and Islamic states.
Religious tensions between India’s Muslim and Christian populations significantly increased before the outbreak of the First World War.
British passenger ships and shipping companies made significant profits by transporting Muslim pilgrims on the hajj from India to Mecca and Medina.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain the point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience of a source.
